title: BBC Local Live: Herefordshire & Worcestershire on Friday 24 February 2017 - BBC News
summary: storm doris clear-up - 250 trees brought down .
rise in the number calling child sex images helpline .
woman kept from egyptian husband by income rules .
history of wartime munitions factory documented .

documents.title: munitions factory anniversary marked
text: munitions factory anniversary marked

documents.title: bridge base installed after collapse
text: bridge base installed after collapse

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for live updates this week .
we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .
keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: in friday sunset
text: thanks to paul wilde for sharing these photos which he took this afternoon .
what a difference a day makes - this time yesterday the winds were causing havoc , today , everything is still .
this was taken on bredon hill at hanbury churchyard .
share your photos with us on .
email , .
tweet us on @ twitterid .
or message us via .
facebook .
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: behind the scenes at hereford fc : it 's like 'the opening of a horror film '
text: hereford fc face swindon supermarine at home tomorrow .
ahead of kick-off the club have tweeted a short video of the journey from the dressing room to the dug out .
we could n't help but laugh at one of the replies `` that heavy breathing is scary ! ! ''
- the club 's response : `` it 's the opening to a forthcoming horror film '' .
here 's what fixtures are coming up this weekend :
countdown to kick off !
here 's the journey the players will make from dressing room to pitch tomorrow .
it 's the opening to a forthcoming horror film .
loved my time there , i hope one day to see them back where they belong !
fantastic journey @ twitterid so good the old ground was n't lost when things went belly-up with # herefordunited
nice walk

documents.title: watch : weekend weather forecast
text: cloud will thicken overnight bringing outbreaks of light rain and drizzle and a strengthening breeze .
as a result , it will be much milder and should stay frost free for all - lows of 4c ( 39f ) .
tomorrow will be a largely cloudy , damp and windy day .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: hunt for crowbar wielding robbers
text: police are hunting crowbar wielding robbers who raided a store in kidderminster
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: rugby : three changes to warriors line up
text: worcester warriors have made three changes to their starting line up for tomorrow 's aviva premiership trip to northampton saints .
all three are in the pack where niall annett , phil dowson and sam lewis ( left to right ) come in - among those missing out is chris vui who has up a knock in training this week .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: in history of munitions '200 million bullets ' factory
text: this weekend marks 100 years since the opening of the blackpole munitions factory where 200 million rifle rounds were produced during world war one .
the site , which is now blackpole east industrial estate , was once home to hundreds of men and women during two world wars .
the photo below was taken in the `` case shop '' on 30 june in 1919 - wooden barrells are placed in the middle of the aisles labelled `` bullet '' .
the archive team at worcester city council are looking for volunteers to help discover the factory 's history .
a special party will be held at .
the hive in worcester .
on saturday where people can sign-up .
thank you to worcestershire archive and archaeology service for the images .
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tour series returning to redditch
text: it 's been confirmed that the uk 's favourite cycle race series is coming back to redditch .
author: Redditch Advertiser

documents.title: worcester wolves take part in bbl action tonight on the bbc
text: british basketball returns to bbc sport this evening for the second leg of the bbl trophy semi-final as worcester wolves host plymouth raiders .
in the first leg , plymouth beat worcester 96-78 but can worcester bring it back on their home turf ?
worcester need to win the leg by 19 points to advance to face either leicester riders and cheshire phoenix in the final on 19 march in glasgow .
coverage is live from 19:30 across the bbc sport website , app and selected connected tvs .
to watch online .
click here .
and to learn more about the bbc 's coverage of the bbl and wbbl .
click here .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: six nations 2017 : ben te'o to start for england against italy
text: ben te'o will make his first start for england in sunday 's six nations match with italy .
te'o , who 's 30 , moved to worcester at the start of the season from leinster , and has won five caps as a replacement , but has been named at outside centre for the meeting with the azzurri .
follow coverage of the six nations : england v italy at twickenham on sunday from 15:00 on bbc sport .
and bbc radio 5 live sports extra .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: crowdfunding campaign launched as man prepares to take walking hockey to australia
text: walking hockey is set to go global after interest from australia and new zealand was received following a successful pilot scheme in bromsgrove .
author: Bromsgrove Standard

documents.title: bike challenge to raise money for college for the blind
text: the mayor of hereford is among hundreds of people spending the next 24 hours on a bike to raise money for the city 's royal national college for the blind .
jimmy kenyon is taking part in the entire annual 24-hour spinathon at the point .
we 're off .
hundreds are taking part in the 24 hour fundraising spinathon @ twitterid you can still sponsor teams at

documents.title: storm doris : 'community rallied together '
text: the clear-up operation the day after storm doris continues in herefordshire and worcestershire .
hundreds of homes are still without power across the two counties and further travel disruption is expected .
worcestershire 's highways manager said minor roads and paths will be cleared today and thanked members of the public who helped during the bad weather yesterday .
it really got going around mid-morning and it did n't really stop until 19:00 .
it was a very busy day the priority was to keep main roads clear .
it was really great to see the community come out and help too , bringing the best out of people . ''

documents.title: micro brewery moving to new premises
text: the owners of a worcester brewery are expanding their business by opening up a pub .
the mother and son team , alex and wendy pope , who are behind pope 's brewery , are moving from a warehouse near blackpole to their new venture at the paul pry at the butts .
alex says the new site means they 're able to diversify and keep up with the competition .

documents.title: road closure as bridge work continues
text: the a443 at eastham will be closed from 19:00 in preparation for bridge replacement work to be carried out this weekend .
four giant steel beams are ready .
a crane will be put in place over the weekend ready to install them
according to the council the bridge is due to open to traffic sometime in the spring .
planned closure of a443 at # eastham from 7pm tonight for the weekend for crane lift of bridge replacement beams - diversion via b4202 & a456

documents.title: harriers hope to get promotion push back on track
text: kidderminster harriers head into tomorrow afternoon 's home game with stockport county looking for the win they need to get their promotion push back on track .
but they know it will be tough - stockport are unbeaten in the league since 19 november .
it looks as though they are looking to the history books for inspiration
harriers v @ twitterid past clash : in 2012/13 , the game at stockport saw the hatters come out 1-0 winners .
nathan blissett goes close .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: 'what 's gone wrong at westfields '
text: westfields manager sean edwards says his players have to realise that the season is nine months long after conceding their title hopes are over .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: in ferrai driver has a ( very ) bad day in doris storms
text: a tells a 1,000 words , they say
this bright red supercar got rather soggy yesterday as storm doris swept over the country .
how it got there we 're not sure , but it 's safe to say it should n't be submerged in water .
@ twitterid tweeted a series of photos of the ferrai spotted in kings caple near ross-on-wye .
but this says it all
and shes out # ferrari # pond # kingscaple @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
what photo credit shall i use ?
your twitter handle ?
yes thats fine
thanks ali .
we have used the online with the credit !
these ones are mine but do n't worry about credit- chris is my oh .
@ twitterid watched it go in .
i watched it come out
i will change the credits now !
so in is chris and out is yours ?
similar to the # bugatti in # houston ?
footprints of a soggy ferrari driver
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crews extinguish fire
text: a fire broke out near blakeshall this morning .
two hereford & worcester fire and rescue service crews from kidderminster attended the scene just after 4.30am this morning .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: more calls to child pornography helpline
text: a confidential helpline , designed to help those who 've looked at sexual images of children online , has received calls from 40 people across herefordshire and worcestershire over the last 12 months .
the stop it now helpline , which is run by the alvechurch based lucy faithfull foundation , was set-up to help offenders gain access to the help they need to address their problem .
across the west midlands the number of calls to the helpline has gone up by more than a third , when compared to the previous year .

documents.title: storm doris : power restored
text: the majority of homes affected by power cuts in redditch have had their supplies restored , according to the energy supplier western power .
a number of properties remain affected but this is expected to be rectified this afternoon , the company say .
we 've got most supplies back on in # redditch # b97 , but are working to restore the remaining properties by approximately 12:00 .
jason

documents.title: climber who died after fall named
text: climber who died after fall named

documents.title: history of factory that made 200 million rifle rounds to be documented
text: a new project is hoping to find out more about the blackpole munitions factory which opened in worcester a century ago .
hundreds of workers produced 200 million rifle rounds there during the world war one and the buildings now form part of the blackpole east industrial estate .
of the four cartridge factories built during ww1 - this is the only one left .
this is the only chance we have to record those processes .
we 'll use photos and maps but it 's very important to look at the physical remains .
we 're going to be looking for clues at the fabric of the building to see how they were used . ''
the council is looking for volunteers to help record the history of the building - taking photos and making physical notes about the area .

documents.title: replacement buses continue on cross city train line
text: in the wake of storm doris , buses are still replacing the cross city trains which normally run between lichfield and redditch via birmingham .
here 's a reminder of the affected stations on the route ; those from which passengers can catch a bus ; and the prognosis that the situation is unlikely to get any better today :
replacement buses to shuttle between sutton and lichfield , between longbridge and redditch and longbridge & bromsgrove.^ek
travel advice : cross city line # stormdoris @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid ^ek

documents.title: worcester to manchester by wheelchair
text: the national wheelchair basketball champions are wheeling themselves onto treadmills for up to eight hours today in a bid to raise money .

the team , from the university of worcester , are doing a 111 mile challenge ( the distance between worcester and manchester ) to raise money to pay for the british wheelchair basketball university championships , which takes place in manchester next month .
the team are hoping to raise £ 1,000 , to cover the team 's travel and accommodation expenses..
so far they 've raised £ 270 online .

documents.title: opera company looking for malvern dog to appear in its production
text: an opera company which is coming to malvern next month is on the search for a local dog to appear in its production .
author: Malvern Observer

documents.title: firefighters tackle 'large sawmill blaze '
text: crews have been tackling a `` large fire '' at a sawmill in kidderminster overnight .
hereford & worcester fire and rescue service said two crews attended to the blaze near blakeshall at about 04:35 this morning .
04:35 two # kidderminster crews assisted by # kinver at sawmill fire near blakeshall .
crews using 2 jets , also water carrier from # leominster

documents.title: storm doris : many propoerties affected by power cuts
text: many across herefordshire and worcestershire are still without power this morning in the wake of storm doris .
nearly 300 properties in herefordshire and more than 650 in worcestershire are affected - western power distribution expects most of them to be restored by lunchtime .
highways bosses at worcestershire county council say around 250 trees came down , while the contractors looking after herefordshire 's roads said they 've been called to 80 incidents .
the a49 and a465 in hereford have reopened after the roof of the nearby @ twitterid petrol station was made safe
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: train disruption continues after storm doris
text: disruption across the west midlands continues after storm doris yesterday .
some train services are still affected .
the cross city line will be closed all day between lichfield and redditch and some services to london are cancelled or delayed .
author: Kevin Pashby
BBC WM

documents.title: cross city line closed between lichfield and redditch
text: due to damage to overhead cables on the railway line between redditch and lichfield trent valley all lines are closed .
a bus replacement service in operation , warns london midland .
the cross city line is currently closed , please check here for alternative travel arrangements

documents.title: weather : 'nowhere near as windy as yesterday '
text: cold and bright to start with scattered showers and patchy frost and ice , especially on untreated surfaces .
most of us will have a fine and cold day with much lighter winds and some spells of sunshine - highs of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: friday : live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire
text: welcome to friday .
i 'll be bringing you live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire between now and 18:00 .
i 'll have the latest news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can .
email , .

or message via .
facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow .
keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: storm doris : put away the hoses , break out the chainsaws
text: the fire service have spent the day proving their versatility .
# stormdoris keeping our usar chainsaw crews very busy this afternoon .
scenes made safe in kidderminster & bewdley .

documents.title: storm doris : town centre road likely to be closed overnight
text: broad street in kidderminster could be closed overnight due to unsafe buildings .
broad street # kidderminster likely to remain closed overnight - no pedestrian or vehicle access - unsafe building # stormdoris
morning , do you know if this road is still closed ?
^ds
yes , currently still closed

documents.title: weather : rain tonight , but winds easing
text: we 're forecast some rain tonight , some of it heavy , but the wind should be easing .
lows of 3c ( 37f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: your damp docklow
text: weather watcher swampman shared this of a kettle hole pond at kenchester , herefordshire , with waves caused by storm doris .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: rail disruption to continue this evening
text: rail passengers are being warned to expect more disruption this evening , as workmen battle to clear all the debris off the lines after storm doris .
network rail says its `` orange army of engineers '' have been clearing everything from trees to trampolines and chairs from the track , and bags from overhead power lines .
virgin trains and london midland have both urged customers not to travel if they can avoid it .

documents.title: storm doris : behind the scenes
text: here 's a look into the control room at malvern , where staff are able to direct highways engineers to fallen trees using gps .
# stormdoris control room south in our # malvern depot - highways staff direct nearest gps located team to deal with the next fallen tree

documents.title: storm doris : all hands on deck
text: it 's been very much a team effort in dealing with the effects of storm doris , malvern police have thanked `` public spirited gentleman '' for lending a hand clearing the road .
malvern wells turn at # b4209 fully open thanks to these public spirited gentlemen , drivers thanks for your cooperation & patience .
# doris

documents.title: girl going to us after nhs op halted
text: girl going to us after nhs op halted

documents.title: gritters to follow the wrath of storm doris
text: as if today has n't been bad enough , there 's more bad weather on the way
after # stormdoris says goodbye , we expect road temps to fall sub-zero overnight - gritters will be out later from 8:30pm # giveusabreak

documents.title: fallen tree causes damage at bryngwyn manor
text: keith james has been in touch with me to say a tree has been uprooted in the entrance way to bryngwyn manor , wormelow .
he said it 's caused some damage to the nearby lodge house , but it missed two parked cars .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: historic canal bridge suffers £ 45,000 worth of damage
text: drivers are being warned to take care when driving over canal bridges by the canal and river trust .
a driver has caused £ 45,000 of damage to a bridge over the staffordshire & worcestershire canal .
drivers urged to slow down on region 's historic canal bridges after crash causes £ 45,000 of damage @ twitterid

documents.title: storm doris : engineers needed to 'glue down ' asda roof
text: hereford & worcester have been told engineers were needed to glue the roof down at the asda supermarket near the river wye in hereford .
police have said the road near the a49 and a465 has reopened .
the petrol station is a recent addition and has been open less than six months .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: storm doris : pershore neighbourhood teams attend fallen trees
text: pershore 's neighbourhood teams have been busy today , they 've attended the scene of eight fallen trees so far .
watch out driving the roads today .
lots of trees down .
team have been out to 8 so far .

documents.title: storm doris : more than 9,000 homes without power
text: western power distrubition say over 9,000 homes are without power across herefordshire and worcestershire .
in worcestershire the number of homes without power is 6,332 and 2,801 herefordshire .
this is how the power outage looks nationally .

News Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: storm doris : a49 and a465 closed in hereford
text: west merica police have closed the a49 and a465 in hereford near to the bridge over the river wye and the asda supermarket .
the police force says it 's following safety concerns around the roof of the asda petrol station .

it 's been a very busy day for the emergency services .
thanks to grant willis , from hereford & worcester fire and rescue service , for the

documents.title: storm doris : gusts of 65mph recorded in pershore
text: dave throup from the environment agency has said they have recorded gusts of 65mph in pershore .
he says it is `` pretty lively '' for an inland location .
65mph gust at pershore in last hour .
pretty lively for inland lowland location .
# stormdoris causing widespread damage & disruption take care
i knew that you would be there where the action is !
# stormdoris
@ twitterid appears to have taken out our power here too !
may have to find the candles for later !

documents.title: watch : teamwork and a digger clears road of fallen tree
text: the a443 at top barn just outside worcester was blocked by a fallen tree , but thanks to a digger and lots of people chipping in , the road was cleared within an hour .
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: london midland warns against any rail travel
text: the train operator has issued a blanket warning to people not to bother travelling at all because of the anticipated effects of storm doris .
# stormdoris we are strongly advising against travelling today .
tickets valid for travel today will be accepted for tomorrow .
@ twitterid any chance of the game being re-arranged for tomorrow ? ! ?
your ticket will be accepted tomorrow yes , before 12
indeed it does !
do you expect the situation be better later this afternoon ?
it 's meant to get worse so
by 7pm normal winds in london and northampton
it 's impossible to predict the weather , and i do n't think network rail will want to lift speed restrictions
totally appreciate that .
safety is most important .
trains are not just slow but not leaving at all from euston .
yeah , it 'd be unfair to hold lm accountable this time anyway
agreed .
just want to know if they hope to resume a more normal service late afternoon/evening .
i know the speed limit is in place till 1600 , so if the storm dies down , i presume the west coast mainline
preparing for a night 's stay at coventry train station then !
@ twitterid # stormdoris we are strongly advising against travelling today .

a council crew are on their way to deal with it .

documents.title: visa rules creating 'price on love '
text: visa rules creating 'price on love '
author: Emma Harrison
BBC News

documents.title: life-changing surgery for herefordshire teenager
text: a herefordshire teenager is flying out to the usa at the weekend to have life-changing spinal surgery , after the operation became unavailable on the nhs .
ella tomlinson , who 's 14 and from leominster , will have `` vertebrae tethering '' or vbt , to straighten her spine .
the procedure will leave her with more movement than the operation being offered by the nhs .
her father , steve , told bbc hereford & worcester the operation is costing them £ 140,000 .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: 'inadequate ' school may not stay open
text: a hereford school which is in special measures says it ca n't guarantee it 'll still be open next year after an ofsted report branded it `` inadequate '' .
the robert owen academy say most of their intake come from `` challenged backgrounds '' , and they 've asked the government to recognise them as an alternative provider or special needs school .
they say they 're being judged in the same way as other mainstream schools .

our report clearly identified that this school has a higher than average proportion of pupils with special needs and disabilities - the school is not currently designated as alternative provision and we inspect schools as they are at the time . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: flood alert in place for river wye
text: a flood alert for the river wye has been put in place as storm doris is expected to travel over the midlands today .

documents.title: storm doris road warning
text: people in herefordshire and worcestershire are being warned about heavy winds hitting the two counties .
there 's an amber weather warning in place across the region for storm doris , with winds of between 60mph and 80mph expected .
worcestershire highways have put extra measures in place , including gully emptiers , and they 're regularly checking ford crossings .
if it 's a huge tree [ that 's been blown down ] we will find out about it anyway , as the police will contact us and we 'll be there as fast as we can .
in any of these weather conditions , it 's always a good idea to allow extra time for journeys [ and ] if you see flood water , do n't go driving through it . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: storm doris : redditch market cancelled
text: redditch council says the market is cancelled today because of the severe weather .
today 's # redditch market is cancelled because of the weather warnings in place .
take care out there .

documents.title: watch : high winds on the way as storm doris moves in
text: severe gales will blow across the midlands today .
the worst of the rain will be first thing in the morning but gales will continue all day .
gusts of 60mph are likely in the cities and valleys , and 80mph on hills..
highs of 8c ( 46f ) .

BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: cordon lifted after ww2 military shell uncovered
text: a world war two military shell was discovered in hereford earlier this afternoon during excavation work near a former munitions factory off the holme lacy road .
a 100m cordon and nearby roads were closed while a bomb disposal team and officers were on site at about 13:00 .
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: mp urges women to make more use of rural maternity units
text: the ludlow mp , philip dunne , is urging women to make more use of rural maternity units like the ones in bridgnorth and ludlow .
after a meeting with nhs managers , mr dunne said `` increasing the number of births at each location is important to help secure their long term future '' .
the mp is asking mums who have had babies at the midwife-led units to share their happy experiences , to encourage other women to use the facilities .
he says births and antenatal appointments at ludlow have fallen over the past five years , but have risen in bridgnorth .

in order to be viable and to retain quality committed midwives , our midwife-led units need to have more babies born in our community hospitals each year , to improve upon the average of one or two per week . ''

documents.title: worcester warriors draw themselves for super fans
text: do n't bother with autographs - this is the future .
two young fans met their sporting hereos recently , but instead of asking for squiggly autographs they asked for self portraits .
this is what they got
instead of asking players for their autographs , jack and liam foley asked players to draw each other at our meet the players event !
great idea , well done worcester
val by sharky & vice versa are particular favourites !
it 's like looking at a photograph ! !

documents.title: overnight weather forecast for the west midlands
text: a band of rain from the west will spread across the region this evening .
this will clear in the early hours when strong winds will develop , these strengthening close to gale force over hills by dawn - lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
tomorrow , severe gales will bring disruption in the morning , with a band of rain moving eastwards , though brightening though the afternoon .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: woman stabbed in the stomach in hereford
text: a woman is recovering in hospital after being stabbed in the stomach in hereford , the ambulance service say .
emergency services were called to chepstow walk in the bobblestock area of the city at around 16:30 .
although an air ambulance was called she was taken to hospital by road ambulance .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

text: the 24-year-old lock forward is 6ft8in ( 2.03m ) tall .
breaking news warriors have signed pierce phillips from @ twitterid ahead of the 2017/18 season .
you got yourselves a couple of outstanding players in @ twitterid & @ twitterid sad to see them leaving # topblokes

documents.title: landscape gardener blossoms after winning award

documents.title: worcester city council approves next year 's budget : the details
text: a £ 10.5m budget for worcester city council has been agreed for next year .
here 's a breakdown of what 's been agreed ;
the conservatives had asked for £ 30k to be spent on 80 extra dog poo bins but the idea was rejected in a vote .
now onto an amendment about dog poo .
cons want £ 30k spent on 80 extra dog bins .
i 'm not sure where they 'd all go @ twitterid any ideas ?
the webapp shows the map where users have reported dog poo , hopefully the council will contact us 2 find out where hotspots are
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: worcester city 's new stadium : chairman says club will 'lose money this season '
text: there 's been lots of speculation in recent weeks about the future of worcester city football club - rumours the club might not make it through to the end of the season , might have to undergo voluntary relegation to cut costs , or may move to worcester warrior 's ground at sixways to ground-share have all circulated .
the club 's chairman , anthony hampson , would n't be drawn on the exact nature of the club 's finances , but admitted they 're on course to make a bigger loss than in previous seasons .
he confirmed the planning application for a new stadium at perdiswell in worcester had been submitted , and he hoped the city council would make a decision to approve it in april or may .
the last two seasons , the club 's losses have been cushioned by our two cup runs .
this season has been harder .
we will lose money , there 's no question about it .
we will be staying up if we can . ''
city have been playing at bromsgrove sporting ground and , before that , ground-shared with kidderminster harriers .
while discussions had been held with worcester warriors and their facilities are fantastic , it would be too expensive an option for the club long-term .
perdiswell could be a pipe dream but the club 's bosses are attempting to ring fence as much money as possible to secure its future as a community club .
author: James Pearson
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: historic doors replaced after last year 's break-in
text: historic doors that were smashed down by thieves have been replaced at a cinema in evesham .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: ww2 bomb cordon lifted
text: a police cordon put in place in hereford after a ww2 shell was discovered earlier this afternoon has been lifted , west mercia police say .
officers closed holme lacy road after a shell was found at about 13:00 .
it was n't deemed dangerous and has since been removed by the explosive ordnance disposal team .
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ww2 shell found : uncovered near old munitions factory
text: a world war two shell has been found during exacavation work off the holme lacy road in hereford , police say .
for safety reasons a 100m ( 330ft ) cordon is in force and the road has been closed in both directions from the roundabout at gate house road to fordshill road .
the rotherwas munitions factory ( which made armaments in both ww1 and ww2 , was once sited on either side of the road .

documents.title: housebuilder will do 'all it can ' to help residents dealing with 'sewage , damp and mould '
text: bovis homes have told us they will do all they can to fix issues for residents who have dealt with flooded sewage , damp and mould in their new homes .
it has set aside £ 7m to compensate customers who were sold unfinished builds or properties with electrical and plumbing faults .
the house builders have properties for sale in great barr , redditch and lichfield .
bovis homes say they are sorry for any issues and are talking directly to residents involved .
author: Alice Rosenthal
BBC WM

documents.title: breakingww2 shell found during building work
text: a cordon has been put in place around a site in hereford after a world war two shell was found during excavations , police say .
west mercia police say a bomb disposal unit is at the site on the holme lacy road , and a 100m ( 330ft ) cordon imposed for safety reasons .
holme lacy road has been closed in both directions from the roundabout at gate house road to fordshill road until further notice , police say .
the cordon and road closure has been put in place as a precaution and we are working with explosive experts to remove the shell from the area .
we hope to have this resolved as quickly as possible . ''

documents.title: councillor resigns after child pornography charges
text: malvern hills district council has confirmed that julian roskams has resigned as a councillor .
the 53-year-old former mayor of malvern is set to appear at worcester crown court next month charged with child pornography offences .
he resigned at last night 's council meeting .
author: Gavin Kermack
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: bromsgrove advertiser : the front and back pages
text: the front and back pages of this week 's bromsgrove advertiser .

documents.title: future of football club is at a new stadium , says chairman
text: the chairman of worcester city football club has insisted its long-term future lies with a new stadium at perdiswell .

anthony hampson admitted that the club will make a bigger financial loss this season than previous years , but will survive and almost certainly spend another season ground-sharing at bromsgrove sporting .
the club hopes a decision on plans to build a new 4,419 stadium at perdiswell will be made by the city council in april or may .
the proposal for a community sports stadium includes a floodlit all-weather 3g pitch , secure cycle storage provision and two 20,000 litre below-ground rainwater harvesting tanks .
author: James Pearson
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: dowson prepares to hang up boots for coaching role
text: experienced back row phil dowson will retire from rugby at the end of the season to return to former club northampton saints as an assistant coach .
author: Worcester Observer

documents.title: officer offers £ 25k to keep police dog when he retires
text: the sister of a former west mercia police dog handler says he has offered to pay £ 25,000 to keep his dog , ivy , now he has retired from the force .
sgt david evans was told his four-year-old dog was due to keep working beyond his retirement date as she was highly trained and it would be best to keep her in active service .
the money has been offered to cover the cost of training a new dog for the force .
i think they need a bit more time to understand dave as a person to see that bond between him and his dog .
24/7 david trains with his dog and looks after her at home as well . ''
more than 38,000 people have signed an online petition calling for him to be allowed to keep the dog permanently .
sgt evans , who 's 59 , has been told he will have to pass the animal - a malinois-cross german shepherd - on to another handler to continue working , say the family .

documents.title: storm doris : weather warning in place
text: a weather warning is in place for stormy weather in herefordshire and worcestershire today .
earlier forecasts suggesting the area would miss any heavy rain and severe winds have now changed .
revised # stormdoris warnings just issued .
amber warning area extended into # herefordshire # worcestershire # gloucestershire stay tuned .
thanks @ twitterid what do you think @ twitterid ? - can you go early friday instead ?
love your updates dave keep up the good work !

documents.title: swifts and alvechurch take home a win
text: stourport swifts last night up an important 3-0 win over shepshed dynamo in the midland football league .
alvechurch progressed in the league cup with a 4-1 home win over pelsall villa .
not a bad performance from us in difficult conditions and being down to 10 men for over 70mins .
all 3 youth players did really well tonight
swifts 3 - 0 @ twitterid as swifts put in a very positive and hard working performance just when it was needed most ! !
onto saturday
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: weather warning in place for 'strong winds '
text: there 's an amber warning in place across the west midlands for strong winds associated with storm doris .
gusts of up to 50-60mph and up to 80mph on higher ground are expected between 06:00 and 18:00 tomorrow , the met office is warning .

documents.title: man ordered to pay £ 74 by court after stealing two cans of cider
text: a man was ordered to pay £ 74 by magistrates after stealing two cans of cider .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: new trees to be planted - city 's green budget approved
text: worcester city council has passed its greenest budget in years - .
with plans to spend £ 30,000 on planting new trees and cutting energy costs at the guildhall (
the environmentally friendly measures were added to the budget by the green party , who have only two councillors but hold the balance of power between labour and the conservatives .

i chose amendments that i thought i could get through , i was n't trying to grandstand - i was trying to do things that would have a genuine all-party support and because of that we got them through . ''
the budget also includes a council tax rise of around £ 5 a year for the average household and a freeze on parking charges .
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: fly-tipped fridges in kings norton to be cleared later
text: around 110 fridges which were illegally dumped on an estate in birmingham are due to be cleared up later today .
they will be taken away from kings norton so they can be forensically examined .
birmingham city council says the items have all been stripped of valuable metal and then flytipped .
the authority said the illegal dumping was `` totally unacceptable '' and said staff were trying to identify the perpetrators .
author: Kevin Pashby
BBC WM

documents.title: leading city tory hits out over northern relief link road failures
text: a former mayor of worcester has issued an impassioned plea for the northern relief link road to happen - saying congestion will `` never '' be resolved without it .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: new warriors boss 'hopes it will all come together before the end of the season '
text: worcester warriors ' director of rugby , gary gold , says it 's a steep learning curve but he feels things are heading in the right direction .
warriors have taken five points from their last two aviva premiership matches and gold says they can expect a battle in the forwards at northampton saints on saturday .
i 've still only been here three weeks now - every day i 'm learning more and more .
i 'm getting a lot more insight in terms of the squad and the quality of the players .
hopefully it will all come together before the end of the season . ''
the 49-year-old was appointed last month until the end of the season , with carl hogg retaining his position as head coach .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: fire service 'needs more recruits ' , says union
text: the fire service in herefordshire and worcestershire needs to recruit more on-call crews , otherwise it wo n't cope in the future , according to the fire brigades union .
the union says about 75 % of the firefighters covering this area are made up of retained firefighters and the budget for the coming financial year is staying at £ 33m .

hereford & worcestershire fire and rescue service says there are `` no plans to change the operational response model in respect to the number of full-time and on-call fire appliances '' but it is reviewing crewing systems and `` exploring options for future resilience '' .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: watch : your latest 50-second weather forecast
text: a cloudy day across the west midlands , with outbreaks of rain for many , though some drier interludes are likely too .
otherwise , breezy at first , especially in the south , though the winds will temporarily ease during the afternoon - highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: dream homes turn into nightmares due to 'smell of sewage , damp and mould '
text: residents living in new properties in part of birmingham have told us their dream homes have been wrecked by the stench of sewage , damp and mould .
housing firm bovis homes has set aside £ 7m to compensate customers who were sold unfinished builds - or properties with electrical and plumbing faults .
more than 1,500 people have joined the bovis homes victim group on facebook .
the house builders have properties for sale across the west midlands including great barr , redditch and lichfield .
author: Kevin Pashby
BBC WM

documents.title: wednesday : live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire
text: i 'll be bringing you live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire today , between now and 18:00
i 'll have the latest news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: what 's the local on planned hospital cuts ?
text: the bbc has been analysing plans being put forward by nhs bosses to cut hospital services in two-thirds of england to save money .
locally , there will be a funding gap of £ 336m by 2020-21 in herefordshire and worcestershire if nothing is done , the research shows .
there is an aim to cut the amount of planned treatment for non-life threatening conditions by 20 % in real terms , reduce spending on diagnostic services by 11 % .
and close 200 community beds .
however , even if that goes ahead , there is still predicted to be a significant gap and it is not clear how it will be closed .

a review by the king 's fund think tank of the plans for england as a whole , warned community services were already `` feeling the strain '' and further reductions in the number of hospital beds could de-stabilise services that were already `` stretched to their limits ''

documents.title: dog handler 'devastated ' by police decision
text: the sister of sgt david evans , the police dog handler who has been told he ca n't take his dog with him when he retires says he is `` devastated '' .
west mercia police announced its decision earlier today , after a meeting between sgt evans and the chief constable of west mercia police .
lisa evans said her brother had `` always formed a bond with his dogs '' and suggested it would have been kinder not to have given him a young dog , knowing his retirement was imminent .
she said she wanted `` further discussions and understanding '' from the force .
i think all pet-lovers out there , you know yourself the bonds that are formed , whether it 's a pet or a working dog .
so he 's always had a special bond with his dogs , that 's the sort of person he is . ''

documents.title: brandon trust withdraws services at hereford day centre
text: a charity has pulled out of providing services at a hereford day centre for people with learning disabilities .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: cloudy sky and strong winds will mean a mild night with some rain and drizzle - lows of 10c ( 50f ) .
you can get a detailed forecast here , including warnings of strong winds moving in on thursday .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: £ 300k to 'improve ' traffic incident information
text: up to £ 300,000 is to be spent on improving the way traffic information is shared and used by highways ' staff .
worcestershire county council is among 19 authorities that have been awarded funding for their ideas to improve journeys through digital innovation .
the money is for an information sharing system so incidents can be dealt with quickly by staff and vehicles , the department for transport says .
other projects that will share a total of £ 4m include apps that notify motorists of congestion and free parking spaces , and real time journey information for visually impaired passengers .

documents.title: fly-tipping now 'huge problem '
text: fly-tipping now 'huge problem '

documents.title: youth the focus of police scheme
text: west mercia 's police and crime commissioner john campion has announced the launch of two schemes aimed at protecting young people in the region .
organisations can bid for a share of a £ 240,000 pot to help fund relevant projects .
one scheme focuses on deterring 13 to 16 year olds from turning to crime , while the other aims to make young people safer drivers .

documents.title: football : 'tough ' fixtures for bromsgrove sporting fc
text: bromsgrove sporting fc 's manager says it 'll be a tough two matches against cleethorpes town in the semi-finals of the fa vase .
the team beat buckland athletic 2-0 on sunday securing them a place .
paul smith told bbc hereford and worcester that they were hoping for an easier opponent .
the tie will be played over two legs on the 11 and 18 march .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: storm doris : yellow weather warning
text: herefordshire and worcestershire are expected to avoid the worst of storm doris , although nearby areas have been put on amber alert .
the met office says heavy rain is also likely on thursday , with some snow possible over high ground and gusts of 70 to 80mph for a short time .

documents.title: woman 's lucky escape after car flips in redditch
text: a woman had a `` lucky '' escape last night after her car flipped onto its roof in redditch .
author: Redditch Advertiser

documents.title: your muddy lyonshall
text: here 's rather soggy lyonshall this morning , thanks to bbc weather watcher johnqa .
if you would like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: bromsgrove mp embroiled in business rates dispute
text: communities secretary and bromsgrove mp sajid javid remains at the centre of an on-going row over a national rise in business rates .
the government is dismissing claims today that cabinet ministers underestimated a 5-7 % rise revealed in a letter by mr javid and treasury chief secretary david gauke and sent to tory mps .

in the private email , the ministers said there had been `` a relentless campaign of distortions and half-truths '' about a business rate revaluation which will leave more than a quarter of companies facing higher bills .
they said most firms would not see any rise in their bills and included a list revealing many of the areas facing rate rises are in tory heartlands .

documents.title: racegoer headbutted hole through wall at pub
text: a racegoer who was out celebrating winning with his friends headbutted a hole through the wall of a hereford pub , a court heard .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: rugby : warriors make new signing
text: worcester warriors have confirmed the signing of the jersey reds tight-head prop simon kerrod .
the 24-year-old , who has previously represented the sharks in south africa 's currie cup , will join warriors ahead of the 2017-18 season , the club says .
gary gold , director of rugby , said : `` simon is a powerful scrummager who likes to get around the park .
`` he is a promising prop and we 're looking forward to trying to help him reach the top of his game at warriors . ''
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: more than 100 fridges dumped in a residential street
text: more than 100 fridges have been dumped in a residential street in birmingham , says the council .
the authority says it received a call from the public reporting `` six fridges '' at ithon grove in kings norton but on arrival found 110 .
anyone with information is urged to contact the council 's flytipping team .

documents.title: playing cupid for cows
text: cattle breeding is going high tech - dairy farmer kim petty , from richards castle , is bringing in pioneering equipment from new zealand to work out when a cow 's ready to mate .
he 's won the right to distribute the flashmate kit in the uk .
a device is glued on the cow near the base of its tail and will monitor if other cows have been `` riding '' , a sure sign the cow is in season .
it will then flash red for up to 26 hours giving the optimum time for artificial insemination .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: parking charge changes for hereford
text: herefordshire council is to implement changes to some hereford city centre car parks from monday 27 february .
news - car park changes for hereford 's residents , commuters and visitors via @ twitterid

documents.title: nurse 's delight that man who 'died ' 27 times is on the mend
text: an off-duty nurse credited with saving the life of a man from wednesbury says he 's glad to have been able to help .
ray woodhall was playing walking football in kidderminster when he had a heart attack and then , at worcestershire royal hospital , 27 cardiac arrests .
brad wright , who had been watching the match , insisted on calling an ambulance for ray when he complained of chest soreness .
it would be wonderful and meet up and have a drink .
i 'm just really pleased that he 's ok and since it happened i 've been trying to find out how he was doing .
it 's great news to hear he 's ok . ''

documents.title: retiring policeman refused permission to keep dog
text: a retiring west mercia police dog handler has been refused permission to keep the dog he works with , despite a petition set up asking the force to reconsider .
sergeant david evans , 59 , has been told he will have to pass pd ivy - a malinois cross german shepherd - on to another handler to continue working .
west mercia police says it 's in the best interests of the dog and the force .

chief constable anthony bangham said sometimes dogs at the end of their working lives retired with their handlers , but there was an `` obligation to spend public funds wisely and ensure best value from all our resources '' .
although the dogs live with their handlers and have close relationships with them , they are not family pets .
they belong to the force and are highly valued resources .
pd ivy is very young and has many years service ahead of her . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: when is a ditch not a ditch ?
text: it could be 900 years old and may have played a part in the civil war - now the secrets of a ditch in hereford are about to be uncovered .
a £ 10,000 grant from the heritage lottery fund will be used to investigate the row ditch on the edge of bartonsham meadows which is on the historic england 's at risk register .
the scheduled ancient monument could even once have formed part of offa 's dyke .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: top tory backs completion of northern relief road
text: a leading politician has revealed how he expects worcester 's northern relief link road to be complete `` at some stage in the future '' - insisting the county council 's leadership does want it to happen .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: your beautiful ross-on-wye
text: here 's a lovely of ross-on-wye this morning courtesy of bbc weather watcher terry gorsley .
if you would like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: nhs trusts targeting £ 60m savings
text: plans to save more than £ 60m from nhs services in herefordshire and worcestershire by 2021 have been highlighted in a report by the think tank the kings fund .
the two counties are one of several regions where nhs bosses are considering cutting beds in community hospitals , alongside beds in acute hospitals , like the alex and the worcestershire royal .
yesterday , figures showed the wye valley nhs trust in herefordshire faces an end-of-year deficit of £ 37m , while worcestershire acute faces a deficit of just under £ 35m .
nhs trusts across england ran up deficits totalling about £ 900m in the nine months to december , despite extra funding from the government .
the trusts hope to be able to claw back some spending by the end of the financial year .
author: Gavin Kermack
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: police grants for groups working with young people
text: grants worth £ 600,000 are to be set aside for projects aiming to keep young people safe and away from crime in the west mercia area .
the funding from the police and crime commissioner john campion will be available for charities and organisations running schemes .
some of the funds will also be earmarked to help improve road safety awareness among young drivers .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: video : will you need your umbrella today ?
text: after a cloudy and mild start , cloud will thicken into the afternoon and things will become breezier , with some rain and highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area here .

we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .

text: live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire have finished for the day but local stories will be added automatically through the night .

documents.title: hereford roadshow : 'be clear on cancer '
text: shoppers in hereford are learning how to spot the early signs of cancer .
nurses from public health england are in the maylord shopping centre for two days answering questions as part of the be clear on cancer campaign .

sometimes tummy troubles , particularly those which are lasting for over three weeks can be a sign of cancer - [ we are ] encouraging people to visit their gp because early diagnosis makes it more treatable and improves survival . ''
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: child refugees in france : 'we have the capacity to support them '
text: a worcestershire charity worker , who 's helping unaccompanied child refugees in france , has criticised the government 's handling of their asylum applications .
the government has faced a backlash after it emerged only 350 unaccompanied children will be taken , under what 's called the dubs amendment .
overnight , the home office said it could consider reviewing some asylum claims on behalf of unaccompanied children who are currently refugees in france , if they have family links in the uk .

i think it 's a bit ridiculous that we 've got thousands of vulnerable children living in really difficult situations - extremely horrific situations - that we could be doing something about , that we could open our doors to .
we have the capacity to support them and i think we should be leading by example and doing that . ''

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: another mild night is in store across the region , with some rain and drizzle and lows of about 10c ( 50f ) .

documents.title: travel : worcester ring-road to close overnight
text: worcester 's southern link road will be closed overnight for more than two weeks starting tonight from 21:00 .
first night tonight of overnight closures # worcester southern link road 20 feb - 10 mar , mon-fri , 9pm-6am - details
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: attempted murder trial opens
text: the trial has begun of a hereford man charged with attempted murder .
43-year-old mark ruck , from escley drive in redhill , faces five charges at worcester crown court , including attempting to kill michael ruck in september 2015 .
he is also facing two charges of wounding with intent , a charge of possessing a bladed weapon , and a charge of unlawful wounding .
author: James Pearson
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: `` i feel like a prisoner '' says disabled bromsgrove pensioner after heartless criminals steal his mobility scooter
text: a disabled pensioner who had his mobility scooter stolen by heartless criminals says he has been left to feel like a prisoner '' in his own home .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: worcestershire parkway 'a step closer '
text: a specialist rail contractor has been appointed to build worcestershire parkway railway station at norton .
buckingham group contracting has been awarded the design and build contract , with site preparation and final design work due to start within a few weeks .

once open , worcestershire parkway will enable passengers to use the county 's north cotswold rail link from worcester to oxford and london paddington , as well as to catch regular long-distance cross country services to manchester , nottingham , bristol and cardiff .
for the county to thrive , we need to invest heavily in its infrastructure .

improving transport links across the county is crucial to delivering our vision of creating a 'world-class worcestershire ' by 2025 and worcestershire parkway is fundamental to this vision , along with the dualling of the southern link road and development of worcester six business park . ''
author: James Pearson
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: first ever 'beatles ' track handed over in worcester
text: sir paul mccartney came to a bank in worcester in the 1980s to buy back the first-ever recording made by himself , john lennon and george harrison .
the track `` in spite of all danger '' was recorded in 1958 by the quarrymen - a group founded by john lennon with some school friends two years earlier .

the quarrymen 's pianist , john lowe , held on to the recording for more than two decades , but was approached by sir paul when the beatles star learned it still existed and that john was putting it up for auction .
the idea was that we 'd keep it each of us for a week .
so i had it for a week , john had it for a week , george had it for a week and duff had it for 23 years . ''

documents.title: france honours d-day veteran
text: a worcestershire veteran of the d-day landings has been recognised for his service to the people of france by being awarded the country 's highest honour .
tom bridgewater , from kempsey , was presented with the legion d'honneur at a ceremony at worcester 's guildhall , for his role in helping to liberate france during world war two .
the 93-year-old was a member of the royal army ordnance corps when he landed on sword beach on 6 june 1944 .
i feel absolutely overwhelmed - it is a great honour .
i 'm only sorry my wife is n't here with me . ''
the .
legion d'honneur was established on 19 may , 1802 by napoleon bonaparte .
in 2014 french president , francois hollande , pledged to bestow all surviving british veterans with the award during his speech to commemorate the 70th anniversary of d-day .
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: bromsgrove sporting : 'nice to avoid south shields '
text: bromsgrove sporting 's chairman , mike burke , says it 's `` like a dream '' to be heading to cleethorpes town for the first leg of the semi-final of the fa vase .
the club secured their place in the semis with a dramatic 2-0 home win over buckland at the victoria ground yesterday .
the tie for a place in the wembley final will be played over two legs on 11 and 18 march .
sort of exciting .
yesterday we were saying we did n't care who we drew after how we played the second half yesterday , but it 's nice to avoid south shields .
to get to this stage anyway , as a lot of fans have said , it 's quite like a dream , but all four clubs have got here because they deserve to . ''

documents.title: rugby : dowson ends playing career and begins coaching
text: phil dowson will retire from rugby at the end of the season to begin a coaching role with former club northampton saints , warriors have confirmed .
dowson has made 35 appearances for warriors since he joined the club in in 2015 .

documents.title: your worcester cathedral at sunset
text: this stunning comes from dave bright , of bright skies video .
we 'd love to feature your images - you can email , tweet using @ twitterid or use our facebook page .

documents.title: pub-goer assaulted with a glass
text: a drinker has suffered facial injuries after being assaulted with a glass at a pub in kidderminster , police say .
the woman was involved in an argument at the pub in oxford street shortly after 22:00 on 11 february before she was assaulted .
the police are asking a woman caught on cctv footage to come forward to help in their investigation .

documents.title: villagers 'terrorised ' by hgv 's
text: people living in the herefordshire village of callow say they 're terrified somebody will be killed as more and more vehicles use their lanes as a `` rat run '' .
they 've recorded more than 1,500 vehicles travelling through each day , including many hgv 's , and say they 're now too scared to walk , cycle or ride horses through their lanes .
the police have been called out twice in the past month and there has been four accidents in the last fortnight .

last friday night at about five o'clock apparently , a white transit van coming from the belmont direction , so on the left-hand side of the road , actually , for some unknown reason , has veered across and hit the wall on the right-hand side .
he was jolly lucky , bearing in mind the time , that no one was coming in the opposite direction . ''
villagers are calling for traffic calming measures .

documents.title: ambulance service hires paramedics to work in hazardous environments
text: the ambulance service has hired a crop of specially trained paramedics to work in hazardous conditions .
author: Redditch Advertiser

documents.title: nurse helps save man who survives 27 heart attacks in 24 hours
text: a nurse who 's credited with saving the life of a man playing walking football in kidderminster , says the player survived , despite having a further 26 heart attacks over the following 24 hours .
brad wright was watching the game when he saw ray woodall collapse on the pitch .
he called an ambulance which took mr woodall to the worcestershire royal hospital , where he eventually pulled through .
it 's amazing , i 'm just really pleased ray 's ok .
since it happened i 've been trying to find out whether we 'd heard anything because i obviously knew something was wrong and sometimes we do n't hear what happens to our patients .
so it 's a good news story that he 's ok . ''

documents.title: football : sporting draw cleethorpes town
text: bromsgrove sporting fc will be going north for their fa vase semi-final , having been drawn against cleethorpes town .
the tie will be played over two legs on 11 and 18 march .
sporting got through to the semi-finals after a dramatic 2-0 home win over buckland at the victoria ground yesterday .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: national title for young droitwich boxer
text: a teenage boxer from worcestershire has been crowned aba youth national champion and now has her sights firmly set on representing her country .
sian o'toole , who 's 17 and trains at the droitwich amateur boxing academy , came through a trio of three-round contests in rotherham to lift the title .
she 's now been invited to team gb 's headquarters in sheffield to take part in a selection camp for the next european championships .
sian has worked so hard for this and gone from being a complete novice to now being ranked england 's number one elite youth female in four years - we 're over the moon for her . ''

documents.title: former mayor charged over child pornography
text: a malvern councillor has appeared before magistrates in worcester on child pornography charges .

julian roskams , 53 , of worcester road , malvern , has been charged with six counts of making an indecent photograph/ pseudo-photograph of a child and one count of possessing an extreme pornographic image .
mr roskams , who is a green councillor on malvern town council and malvern hills district council , was the mayor for malvern from 2013 to 2014 .
mr roskams is due to appear at worcester crown court on 20 march .
author: Alistair Binney
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: your photos : magnificent skies over herefordshire
text: it 's a mixture of sunshine and cloud over ross-on-wye this morning - thanks to bbc weather watcher terry gorsley , who took this
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: worcester bank the venue for historic 'beatles handover '
text: a former band-mate of some of the original members of the beatles has revealed that a meeting in worcester helped preserve their first ever recording .
the track `` in spite of all danger '' was recorded in 1958 by the quarrymen , whose members included john lennon , george harrison and paul mccartney .
john lowe , the quarrymen 's pianist , says he had the record for years before meeting with paul mccartney in the 1980 's at a bank in worcester to hand it over to him .
so barclays , bless them , gave me this private room .
the three of us went in there , they brought the briefcase into the room , i presented the record to them . ''

documents.title: should 2,150-home 'super village ' for west worcester be watered down ?
text: a daring bid to water down a 2,150-home `` super village '' in west worcester can today be revealed - amid serious concern it will worsen congestion , damage businesses and force school closures .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: female explorers in training for south pole trek
text: a team of british soldiers , including two from herefordshire and worcestershire , are part of a team preparing to become the first all-female group to walk across antarctica .
major sandy hennis , from redditch , and lieutenant rosanna baker , from hereford , will join exercise ice maiden , which will test whether women soldiers can endure the same extremes as men .
training for 80-day south pole trek in september is currently taking place in norway .
among the many challenges is coping with extreme cold when you need a loo break .

documents.title: malvern hills footpath closed for repairs
text: the path runs from westminster bank in malvern to sugarloaf hill .
temporary path closure from today till fri 25th feb # malvernhills please use alternative routes @ twitterid

documents.title: man found in possession of thousands of indecent images of children spared jail
text: a man who was found in possession of thousands of indecent images of children - the youngest aged just six - has been spared jail .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: football : sporting one step closer to wembley dream
text: bromsgrove sporting are through to the semi-finals of the fa vase after a dramatic 2-0 home win over buckland athletic at the victoria ground yesterday .
sporting had to weather an early storm in which buckland had a goal disallowed and a penalty saved by bromsgrove 's nathan vaughan .
a liam spink penalty and a goal from chris lloyd saw sporting through to a famous win .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: after a misty start there could be a few brighter intervals today , but also the risk of light rain or drizzle .
you can find a full forecast for your area here .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on monday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
